items.title: 3 Dividend-Paying Stocks Bucking the Marketâ€™s Trend
items.author: Marketbeat.Com
items.description: Despite the broader market downturn, Coca-Cola, Johnson & Johnson, and McDonald's have shown resilience, with their dividend-paying stocks outperforming the market.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Coca-Cola's stock is up nearly 15% year-to-date, driven by a surprise earnings beat and continued momentum.
Johnson & Johnson has climbed 12.2% year-to-date, outperforming the broader market, and its strong earnings report has boosted investor confidence.
McDonald's has outperformed the market with a 5.15% year-to-date return, and its resilience is evident in its ability to maintain its stock price near 52-week highs.
